metadata.titleEn: Dataset of Heihe integrated observatory network: automatic weather station of Huazhaizi desert steppe station, 2022
metadata.titleCn: 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网：花寨子荒漠站自动气象站（2022）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the observation system of Meteorological elements gradient of Huazhaizi desert steppe station from January 1 to December 31, 2022. The site (100.3201°E, 38.7659°N) was located on a desert steppe surface in the Huazhaizi, which is near Zhangye city, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1731 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP45AC; 5 and 10 m, north), wind speed and direction profile (windsonic; 5 and 10 m, north), air pressure (CS100; 2 m), rain gauge (TE525M; 10 m), four-component radiometer (CNR1; 6 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (SI-111; 6 m, south, vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFP01; 3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (109ss-L; 0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0 m), soil moisture profile (ML3; -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5 m and Ta_10 m; RH_5 m and RH_10 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_5 m and Ws_10 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_5 m and WD_10 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_60 cm, Ts_100 cm) (℃), soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_60 cm, Ms_100 cm) (%).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2022-6-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2022年1月1日至2022年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网中游花寨子荒漠站气象要素观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市花寨子，下垫面是盐爪爪山前荒漠。观测点的经纬度是100.3201E, 38.7659N，海拔1731m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；气压计安装防水箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速风向传感器架设在5m、10m处，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm和100cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m、Ta_10m、RH_10m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_5m、WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_5m、WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)和土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm）（单位：摄氏度）。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；风速风向偶尔出现一些错误值；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2022-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域被先前的研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the primary method for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field observations, remote-sensing observations, or numerical simulations?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 观察绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水蒸气和碳交换的主要方法是基于实地观测、遥感观测还是数值模拟？
Disjunctive.AnswerEn: field observations, remote-sensing observations, numerical simulations
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 现场观测，遥感观测，数值模拟

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the data processing and quality control procedure for hydrometeorological data primarily focused on data collection, data processing, or data archiving and sharing?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 水文气象数据的数据处理和质量控制程序主要集中在数据收集、数据处理还是数据归档和共享？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What are the key elements observed in a meteorological dataset from an arid region?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区的气象数据集中观察到的关键元素有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: Air temperature, relative humidity, air pressure, precipitation, wind speed and direction, radiation components, surface radiation temperature, soil heat flux, soil moisture, soil temperature
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 空气温度，相对湿度，气压，降水，风速和风向，辐射分量，地表辐射温度，土壤热通量，土壤湿度，土壤温度

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where are meteorological sensors typically positioned for data collection in desert observation stations?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 气象传感器通常在沙漠观测站的数据收集位置在哪里？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Who might need to refer to quality control procedures when handling observational data from arid regions?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 谁可能在处理干旱地区的观察数据时需要参考质量控制程序？

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to monitor soil moisture profiles in arid and semiarid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于监测干旱和半干旱地区土壤湿度剖面的数据收集方法的示例？
Example.AnswerEn: In the field of arid and semiarid regions, soil moisture profiles are monitored using soil moisture sensors that are buried at various depths, such as 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 60cm, and 100cm, to collect data on volumetric water content in the soil.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，土壤水分剖面通过埋设在不同深度的土壤水分传感器进行监测，例如2厘米、4厘米、10厘米、20厘米、40厘米、60厘米和100厘米，以收集土壤中的体积水分含量数据。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when collecting long-term hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert systems?
Example.QuestionCn: 在收集绿洲-沙漠系统的长期水文气象数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in collecting long-term hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert systems includes dealing with ecological environment degradation issues, such as drying rivers and lakes, and land desertification, which can affect the accuracy and consistency of data collection.
Example.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集长期水文气象数据的一个挑战是应对生态环境退化问题，例如河流和湖泊干涸以及土地沙漠化，这可能会影响数据收集的准确性和一致性。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific attributes are measured to understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 为了理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换，测量了哪些具体属性？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: energy fluxes, water vapor fluxes, carbon fluxes, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 能量通量、水汽通量、碳通量、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水、土壤湿度剖面

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many data points are collected daily at the 花寨子荒漠站 automatic weather station?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 花寨子荒漠站自动气象站每天收集多少个数据点？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in the middle and lower reaches of the 黑河流域 since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在黑河流域的中下游地区建立了多少个地表通量和气象站？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many soil temperature measurement levels are used in the 花寨子荒漠站 data collection?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 花寨子荒漠站的数据收集使用了多少个土壤温度测量层次？

Definition.QuestionEn: What are oasis–desert systems in the context of arid and semi-arid regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的背景下，什么是绿洲-沙漠系统？
Definition.AnswerEn: An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that supports both ecological environments and economic development. Oasis–desert systems play a crucial role in maintaining stable ecological environments and agricultural productivity, especially in regions such as western China.
Definition.AnswerCn: 绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，支持生态环境和经济发展。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用，特别是在中国西部地区。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the function of an eddy covariance system in data collection methods?
Definition.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统在数据收集方法中的功能是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: An eddy covariance system is used for acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data, which includes measurements of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes. This system is crucial for understanding the exchange processes in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Definition.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统用于获取半小时的湍流通量数据，包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的测量。该系统对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的交换过程至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What potential methodologies can be inferred for ensuring the accuracy and reliability of meteorological data collected in arid and semiarid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以推断出哪些潜在的方法来确保在干旱和半干旱地区收集的气象数据的准确性和可靠性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: To ensure accuracy and reliability, methodologies such as installing sensors at various heights and orientations, using protective measures like waterproof boxes for sensitive equipment, conducting regular data quality checks, removing duplicate entries, and filtering out values that exceed physical or instrumental limits are employed. Standardized formats for recording date and time also help maintain data consistency.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 为了确保准确性和可靠性，采用了多种方法，如在不同高度和方向安装传感器，使用防水箱等保护措施来保护敏感设备，定期进行数据质量检查，删除重复条目，以及过滤掉超过物理或仪器限制的值。标准化的日期和时间记录格式也有助于保持数据的一致性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can long-term observational data contribute to understanding the interactions between oasis and desert systems in terms of energy and water vapor exchange?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据如何有助于理解绿洲与沙漠系统之间在能量和水汽交换方面的相互作用？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational data can provide insights into the quantitative characteristics of energy and water vapor exchange, which are crucial for understanding oasis–desert interactions. Such data are essential for achieving sustainable development goals, maintaining ecological stability, and supporting socio-economic development in these regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据可以提供关于能量和水汽交换的定量特征的见解，这对于理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。这些数据对于实现可持续发展目标、维护生态稳定以及支持这些地区的社会经济发展是必不可少的。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the inferred challenges of collecting and processing data in the oasis–desert ecosystems, and what solutions might be implemented to overcome these challenges?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集和处理数据的推测挑战是什么，以及可以实施哪些解决方案来克服这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges include ecological degradation, such as drying rivers and increased desertification. Solutions might involve establishing multiple observation stations to capture diverse data, using advanced instruments like eddy covariance systems, and implementing rigorous data processing and quality control procedures to ensure accurate and usable data outputs.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 挑战包括生态退化，例如河流干涸和沙漠化加剧。解决方案可能涉及建立多个观测站以捕捉多样化的数据，使用先进的仪器如涡度协方差系统，并实施严格的数据处理和质量控制程序，以确保数据输出的准确性和可用性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the challenges in maintaining long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，维持能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测面临哪些挑战？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing ecological environment degradation, which includes the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent occurrences of dust storms. These environmental crises, especially prevalent in inland river basins along the Silk Road, contribute significantly to the challenges in maintaining long-term observations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化，包括河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁发生的沙尘暴。这些环境危机，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的内陆河流流域尤为明显，显著增加了维持长期观测的挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable oasis development?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在可持续绿洲发展中保持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems is critical because oases are unique ecological landscapes in arid and semi-arid areas that support more than 90% of the population in these regions, despite comprising less than 10% of the total area. They play a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity, which are essential for the economic and ecological security in western China.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要，因为绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，尽管仅占总面积的不到10%，却支持了这些地区90%以上的人口。它们在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着关键作用，这对中国西部的经济和生态安全至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period for collecting hydrometeorological data in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用10分钟平均周期的自动气象站在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集水文气象数据的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period for collecting hydrometeorological data can result in high-resolution temporal datasets that are crucial for understanding detailed energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes in oasis–desert ecosystems. These datasets can provide insights into the interactions between oasis and desert systems, which are essential for maintaining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期收集水文气象数据，可以获得高分辨率的时间数据集，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中详细的能量、水蒸气和碳交换过程至关重要。这些数据集可以提供绿洲与沙漠系统之间相互作用的见解，这对于维持生态稳定和支持可持续发展是必不可少的。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the presence of long-term observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems impact the understanding of ecological stability in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集的存在，来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统，可能会对理解干旱地区的生态稳定性产生怎样的影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems can significantly enhance the understanding of ecological stability in arid regions by providing comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes. This information is vital for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and assessing the balance required for sustainable oasis development, particularly in the context of carbon peaking and neutrality goals.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的长期观测数据集可以显著增强对干旱地区生态稳定性的理解，因为它们提供了关于能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的综合数据。这些信息对于识别绿洲–沙漠之间的相互作用以及评估可持续绿洲发展的所需平衡至关重要，特别是在碳达峰和碳中和目标的背景下。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications for data accuracy and reliability when employing eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for measuring turbulent flux data in oasis–desert areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪测量湍流通量数据时，对数据准确性和可靠性的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Employing eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for measuring turbulent flux data can lead to high accuracy and reliability in capturing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes in oasis–desert areas. This approach allows for detailed and precise measurements that are critical for understanding the dynamics of oasis–desert ecosystems and their influence on the carbon balance and ecological security of arid regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 采用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪测量湍流通量数据，可以在捕捉绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换过程中实现高精度和可靠性。这种方法允许进行详细而精确的测量，对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统的动态及其对干旱地区碳平衡和生态安全的影响至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended outcomes of collecting long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 收集绿洲-沙漠生态系统中长期的能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据的预期结果是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The intended outcomes are to understand the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality, support ecological security, and promote sustainable development in these areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 预期结果是了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的基本特征，以实现碳达峰和碳中和的目标，支持生态安全，并促进这些地区的可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain a balance between oasis and desert systems in arid and semiarid regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡是重要的原因是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Maintaining this balance is crucial to achieve sustainable oasis development, protect ecological stability, and support socioeconomic development by understanding the interactions in oasis–desert systems and addressing environmental degradation challenges such as land desertification and dust storms.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 保持这种平衡对于实现可持续的绿洲发展、保护生态稳定以及支持社会经济发展至关重要，这需要理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的相互作用，并应对诸如土地沙漠化和沙尘暴等环境退化挑战。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What drives the need for a comprehensive suite of observational datasets in oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，驱动对全面观测数据集需求的因素是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The need is driven by the requirement to quantitatively understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, recognize oasis–desert interactions, and address ecological crises in arid and semiarid regions, particularly in areas affected by drying up of water bodies and land degradation.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 这一需求源于对能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解的要求，识别绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，并应对干旱和半干旱地区的生态危机，特别是在水体干涸和土地退化影响的区域。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the procedures to ensure data quality and accuracy in meteorological data collection at the 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保黑河流域地表过程综合观测网气象数据收集质量和准确性的程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The procedures include ensuring 144 data entries per day (every 10 minutes), marking missing data with -6999, removing duplicate records, deleting values that exceed physical significance or instrument range, marking questionable data with red text, and standardizing date and time formats in a single column.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 程序包括确保每天144个数据条目（每10分钟一次），用-6999标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超出物理意义或仪器范围的值，用红色文本标记可疑数据，以及将日期和时间格式标准化为单列。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the installation of sensors and instruments managed to capture diverse meteorological and soil parameters in arid regions like the 黑河流域?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在像黑河流域这样的干旱地区，传感器和仪器的安装是如何管理的，以捕捉多样的气象和土壤参数？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Instruments are strategically placed at specific heights and orientations: air temperature and humidity sensors at 5m and 10m facing north, barometers in waterproof boxes, rain gauges at 10m, wind sensors at 5m and 10m facing north, radiation instruments at 6m facing south, infrared thermometers at 6m facing south with downward probes, and soil sensors at various depths and distances from the meteorological tower.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 仪器被战略性地放置在特定的高度和方向：空气温度和湿度传感器位于5米和10米，朝北方向；气压计放置在防水箱内；雨量计位于10米；风速传感器位于5米和10米，朝北方向；辐射仪器位于6米，朝南方向；红外温度计位于6米，朝南方向，带有向下探头；土壤传感器位于不同深度和距离气象塔的地方。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are used to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems to support sustainable development and ecological security?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 为了支持可持续发展和生态安全，维护绿洲与沙漠系统之间平衡的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: A comprehensive understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems is emphasized, supported by long-term observations and quantitative analysis. This involves maintaining observational networks, analyzing interactions, and using datasets that include energy, water vapor, carbon fluxes, and hydrometeorological data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的全面理解得到了强调，支持这一理解的是长期观察和定量分析。这涉及维护观测网络、分析相互作用，并使用包括能量、水蒸气、碳通量和水气象数据在内的数据集。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data processing techniques enable the effective quality control of meteorological observations in arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据处理技术能够有效地对干旱地区的气象观测进行质量控制？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedures include ensuring complete daily data collection, removing duplicate records, and deleting data that exceed physical or instrument limits, as well as marking questionable data for further review.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序包括确保每日数据的完整收集、删除重复记录、删除超过物理或仪器限制的数据，以及标记可疑数据以便进一步审核。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the use of automatic weather stations enable the collection of comprehensive hydrometeorological datasets in oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 自动气象站的使用如何在绿洲-沙漠系统中实现全面的水文气象数据集的收集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Automatic weather stations enable the collection of comprehensive datasets by measuring various parameters such as radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture with a 10-minute average period.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 自动气象站通过测量辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度等各种参数，能够收集全面的数据集，数据采集周期为10分钟平均值。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in ensuring the quality and completeness of continuous meteorological data in arid and semiarid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，确保连续气象数据的质量和完整性可能面临挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological challenges such as river and lake drying, vegetation degradation, and land desertification, which can impact the consistent collection of meteorological data. Additionally, data quality control involves removing erroneous values and ensuring consistent recording formats, which can be affected by environmental factors and technical limitations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态挑战，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化和土地沙漠化，这可能影响气象数据的持续收集。此外，数据质量控制涉及去除错误值和确保记录格式的一致性，这可能受到环境因素和技术限制的影响。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you evaluate the effectiveness of the data collection methods employed for monitoring meteorological variables in arid and semiarid oasis–desert systems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在干旱和半干旱绿洲-沙漠系统中用于监测气象变量的数据收集方法的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods employed, which include the use of automatic weather stations with 10-minute average periods and eddy covariance systems, seem effective for capturing detailed hydrometeorological data, such as radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles. These methods allow for comprehensive long-term observations that are critical for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 所采用的数据收集方法，包括使用10分钟平均周期的自动气象站和涡度协方差系统，似乎有效地捕捉了详细的水文气象数据，如辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面。这些方法允许进行全面的长期观测，对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In your opinion, how comprehensive is the current dataset in capturing the necessary parameters for understanding oasis–desert interactions, and what additional data could enhance its scope?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在您看来，目前的数据集在捕捉理解绿洲与沙漠相互作用所需的参数方面有多全面？还有哪些额外的数据可以增强其范围？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The current dataset is quite comprehensive as it includes energy, water vapor, carbon fluxes, hydrometeorological data, and soil and vegetation parameters, which are crucial for understanding oasis–desert interactions. However, incorporating additional data on long-term climate trends and human-induced changes could further enhance its scope and provide deeper insights into the ecological and socioeconomic dynamics of these regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据集相当全面，因为它包括能源、水蒸气、碳通量、水文气象数据以及土壤和植被参数，这些对于理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。然而，纳入有关长期气候趋势和人类活动变化的额外数据，可以进一步增强其范围，并提供对这些地区生态和社会经济动态的更深入见解。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm not clear on how challenges like ecological degradation in arid regions are addressed through these observational datasets.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不清楚如何通过这些观测数据集来解决干旱地区的生态退化等挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The observational datasets provide long-term data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, which are crucial for understanding and addressing ecological degradation issues such as drying rivers, vegetation degradation, and desertification.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 观测数据集提供了关于能量、水汽和碳交换的长期数据，这对于理解和解决生态退化问题，如河流干涸、植被退化和沙漠化，至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how these datasets contribute to understanding the interactions between oasis and desert systems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白这些数据集如何有助于理解绿洲和沙漠系统之间的相互作用。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The datasets include comprehensive observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, which are essential for recognizing interactions between oasis and desert systems and supporting ecological and socioeconomic stability.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 这些数据集包括对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的全面观察，这对于识别绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用以及支持生态和社会经济的稳定至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the methods used for data collection in arid and semiarid regions, specifically focusing on the instrumentation and parameters observed.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请概述在干旱和半干旱地区用于数据收集的方法，特别关注仪器和观察的参数。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involve using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period to observe parameters like radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Instruments such as eddy covariance systems and scintillometers are used to acquire turbulent flux data, while other sensors measure air temperature, relative humidity, wind speed, wind direction, soil moisture, and soil temperature at various depths.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括使用自动气象站，以10分钟的平均周期观察辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面等参数。使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪等仪器获取湍流通量数据，而其他传感器则测量不同深度的空气温度、相对湿度、风速、风向、土壤湿度和土壤温度。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the challenges faced in collecting and processing data from oasis–desert systems in arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 描述在干旱地区收集和处理来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据时面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting and processing data from oasis–desert systems include ecological environment degradation such as drying rivers and lakes, natural vegetation degradation, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. Data quality control measures are essential to ensure accuracy, requiring the exclusion of erroneous values, handling of missing data, and removal of duplicates. Additionally, maintaining a balance between oasis and desert systems is critical for sustainable development.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 收集和处理绿洲-沙漠系统数据的挑战包括生态环境退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化以及频繁的沙尘暴。数据质量控制措施对于确保准确性至关重要，这需要排除错误值、处理缺失数据和去除重复数据。此外，维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡对于可持续发展至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please discuss how datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas are structured and shared for research purposes.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请讨论与绿洲-沙漠地区的能源、水汽和碳交换相关的数据集是如何结构化和共享以供研究使用的。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas include observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, along with hydrometeorological data, vegetation, and soil parameters. These datasets are structured to include long-term data from land surface flux and meteorological stations, ensuring comprehensive coverage. The data are archived and shared freely through platforms like the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center, supporting ongoing research and data accessibility.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 与绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换相关的数据集包括能量、水汽和碳通量的观测数据，以及水文气象数据、植被和土壤参数。这些数据集的结构包括来自地表通量和气象站的长期数据，确保了全面的覆盖。这些数据被归档并通过国家西藏高原数据中心等平台免费共享，支持持续的研究和数据可获取性。
